alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 8:28PM EST until February 21 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-211730- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.W.0008.000000T0000Z-220221T2100Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.220217T2239Z.220219T0645Z.220225T0600Z.NO/ 828 PM EST Sun Feb 20 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. At 13.3 feet, Flood waters reach Newport Avenue in Uhrichsville as well as East 12th Street and North Main Street half way to East 11th Street. Phac Park along Little Stillwater Creek in Dennison is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Sunday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 8.4 feet and then begin rising Wednesday morning. It will then rise above flood stage Thursday morning to 10.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will fall below flood stage again early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
